page.title: 04FARMING & CONSERVATION
page.content: The landscape is mainly agricultural and to the N.E. is the attractive Avon Valley. Most of the farms have dairy cattle but there are some sheep and pigs . Though there is artificial insemination one farm keeps a freisian bull who is a champion. He glares at you in a sly way. Conservation is a big issue and includes use of chemicals and clearing hedges and woods. Some fields have been enlarged to grow {wheat}.This has meant removing habitat for hedgerow life.One farmer has planted extra trees in inaccessible parts of fields. There is some pressure to thin the woods . In springtime Pomeroy Wood is carpeted with bluebells and you may find rare orchids if you are lucky. The land is criss-crossed with footpaths but there is little public open space.
